windowsSymlinks.title: Editor symlinks
windowsSymlinks.description: Choose whether project editors use optional symbolic links or stay with local copies.
windowsSymlinks.checkbox: Use symbolic links for Windows project editors. This stays off by default so you can opt in when you are ready for potential elevation prompts during editor updates.
windowsSymlinks.note: Changing this setting does not convert existing project links; it only affects how future editor refreshes behave.

enableDescription.line1: When enabled, Godot Launcher links each project to the installed editor instead of copying it.
enableDescription.line2: This keeps disk usage low, but Windows may request administrator approval when new symlinks are created.
enableDescription.line3: Existing projects keep their current local copies until their editor version is changed or reinstalled.

disableDescription.line1: Switch back to local copies to avoid elevation prompts. Godot Launcher will copy the editor files into each project instead.
disableDescription.line2: Existing symlinks remain in place until their editor version is changed or reinstalled.
